qas.question: What is the last step in the stemmatic method?
At what point can a critic using the stemmatic become less concerned with critical analysis?

answers.text: the critic employs conjecture at every step of the process

qas.question: Why may the dominant reading may be the weaker reading?

answers.text: , it may be no more than fortuitous that more witnesses have survived that present a particular reading

qas.question: What is the first step in the stemmatic method?
What judgement produces the correct result?
Which reading does the critic select when there are only two witnesses at the same tree?
A reading that occurs left often is always considered what?
